summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview conducted on September 1, 2021, with Lieutenant [REDACTED], an Operations Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript, signed forms, and MCC assignment rosters and count documentation from August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is the subject of the OIG investigation. He is referred to by his register number 76318-054.

persons.name: Lieutenant [REDACTED]
persons.role: Operations Lieutenant, BOP, MCC New York
persons.context: A Federal Bureau of Prisons lieutenant who was on duty at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive. He was voluntarily interviewed by OIG agents on September 1, 2021.

persons.name: Senior Special Agent [REDACTED]
persons.context: A Senior Special Agent with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General who, along with a Special Agent, conducted the voluntary interview of Lieutenant [REDACTED] on September 1, 2021.

persons.name: Special Agent [REDACTED]
persons.context: A Special Agent with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General who, along with a Senior Special Agent, conducted the voluntary interview of Lieutenant [REDACTED] on September 1, 2021.

connections.description: The Senior Special Agent, as part of the OIG investigation team, interviewed Lieutenant [REDACTED] regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The Special Agent, as part of the OIG investigation team, interviewed Lieutenant [REDACTED] regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Lieutenant [REDACTED] was an Operations Lieutenant at the MCC New York where Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive within his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

events.title: OIG interview of MCC Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent [REDACTED] and Special Agent [REDACTED] of the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of Lieutenant [REDACTED] at the MCC New York regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Email referenced in attachments
events.description: An email from July 30, 2019, is listed as an attachment to the OIG memorandum, though its content is not described.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein as of September 2021, more than two years after the event.
A key witness interviewed was Lieutenant [REDACTED], an Operations Lieutenant who was on duty at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019, the day Epstein was found dead.
The investigation collected detailed prison records including daily assignment rosters and inmate count documentation from August 9-10, 2019.
The document is a formal OIG memorandum that explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, indicating it is a factual record of an investigative step.
